title: Michael Owen says Marcus Rashford should have been given a penalty in Manchester United AZ Alkmaar
text:
Former Manchester United striker Michael Owen feels his old club were hard done by after Marcus Rashford was not awarded a penalty during the Europa League draw with AZ Alkmaar.

The England international had run into the box before cutting back on the ball when was brought down by Stijn Wuytens in the 0-0 draw at the Kyocera Stadium.

The referee did not give United the spot kick and there was no VAR to intervene as the technology is not in use in the group stages of the competition.

Marcus Rashford was not awarded a penalty after being brought down in the box

The England international had run into the box before a late challenge felled the striker

The referee looked to his assistant before waving away Manchester United penalty appeals

BT Sport showed close up replays of the tackle by Stijn Wuytens in the 0-0 draw on Thursday

Owen felt that Rashford should have been handed the penalty.

'I think this is definitely a penalty' he said on BT Sport. 'How the linesman on that side can’t say something.

'The ref gesticulates to the linesman then puts the thumbs up. How they both can come to that conclusion is just amazing.'

Meanwhile, Brazilian midfielder Fred endured yet another poor night in a United shirt. Solskjaer played the £52million signing and in his chance to impress the boss, Fred failed to deliver, losing the ball on multiple occasions.

Fred was lucky to evade punishment for a clumsy push on an AZ Alkmaar opponent

United were fortunate to evade any punishment when the 26-year-old looked to have brought down an Alkmaar attacker during a corner routine. Again, the referee waved away appeals.

'(Was it a penalty?) Yes definitely, that would have compounded a real miserable night for Fred.

'First hand goes on then the second, it’s because he’s not concentrating, he’s looking at the ball. I thought it was a penalty.'

United have picked up four points from their opening two games in Group L as they look to win the Europa League again after Jose Mourinho's triumph in 2017.
description: The England international had run into the box before cutting back on the ball when was brought down by Stijn Wuytens in the 0-0 draw at the Kyocera Stadium in their Europa League contest.
